problem_summary_simple: Find the next lexicographically greater permutation of an array of integers.
problem_summary_technical: Identify the first decreasing element from the right, swap it with the smallest element to its right that's larger, then reverse the suffix.
key_insights: The algorithm relies on finding the first element from the right that is smaller than its next element (the pivot).
The element to swap with the pivot is the smallest element to the right of the pivot that is greater than the pivot.
Reversing the suffix after the swap ensures the smallest possible lexicographical order for the remaining elements.

Both approaches correctly implement the standard algorithm for finding the next permutation.
